data.text: @miranda_renate @drbeen_medical Need to keep shouting loud. Can you post where info came from that's checkable for my friends that are sheep and took the vaccine so they could go on holiday. I thought they were smarter than that.

@Maurshk @drbeen_medical If people die after vaccination it is because they are old, have comorbidity and died with covid, not from covid. But before vaccination or non-vaccinated die from covid even if they have comorbidity and are old. That is very wrong, don't you think? What does this mean?

@Maurshk @drbeen_medical Ah, if that's how it works: what about all the people who died -with- covid before vaccination started? And the non-vaccinated who died? Many probably had comorbidity and died with covid, not from covid. How many years of life are we winning, and how many  were lost with measures

@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical The UK vaccine rollout has been done in 9 bands, starting with 90+, then 80+. etc. This means pretty much everyone be doubled vaxxed is 60+ or has underlying health issues. Also we don't distinguish died from vs died *with" covid in the death stats.
@Muddle85071766 @miranda_renate @drbeen_medical Agreed. A blunt comparison of stats like Miranda is trying to do is ridiculous!

@BobFlemming73 @miranda_renate @drbeen_medical Mate the data is on a moving target, the vax % goes up from a very low base and the unvax % goes down from a very high base.  The calculation needs to take the changing situation into account and use more up to date information.

@miranda_renate @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical I have no issue with you questioning differences.

But that tweet is wrong. It compares vaccinated with unvaccinated group directly. You can't do this unless you're trying to say there's no difference between chance of getting Covid between groups. My point all along.

@miranda_renate @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Oh, so do don't have any idea why there's a difference. And there was me thinking you were suggesting "immunopathology" with zero evidence. Oh yea, I know why it was because of the #immunopathology
@BobFlemming73 @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Oh look, another question mark. There is even a 'why' in there...   https://t.co/VfZCYItluk

@BobFlemming73 @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical https://t.co/K8z0MOiuxM
Check out the questionmark! >?< 'The main purpose of a question mark, perhaps unsurprisingly, is to indicate that a sentence is a question.' See, not a conclusion duh.

@BobFlemming73 @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Conclusion? Again: you must have mist my >>question<< mark. What do you not understand from the use of a question mark? It is not a >>conclusion<<mark. But all previous attempts of developing a coronavirus vaccine ended in immunopathology.
@miranda_renate @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Quite a conclusion to jump to with zero evidence....!
@BobFlemming73 @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Uhm, I think you missed the questionmark at the end of my tweet....

@miranda_renate @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical I'm not saying we shouldn't check the reasons why there is this discrepancy.

But, especially seeing you haven't even given a plausible explanation of why the relationship could be causal, it's not appropriate to stop fitting brakes to bikes....I mean vaccinating people.

@miranda_renate @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Why there's an increased incidence of fatal collisions among braked cyclists isn't known. Could be a causal link (e.g. brakes induce a wobble) or not; e.g - something about those that fit brakes to their bikes makes them more at risk of fatal collisions in the first place.

@BobFlemming73 @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Sorry but, quacking ducks have no place in science. They should look into this and rule out serious problems because the vaccines are still in trial phase! Mortality rate 570% should be looked into. Not only flaunt the 5%. Cherry picking.

@miranda_renate @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Agreed. But have you seen any data to suggest this might be the case, or indeed anything to suggest comorbidities, or some other non-causal relationship, are NOT the explanation?

If it looks like a duck and quacks like a duck....

@BobFlemming73 @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical I thought about that too. But what happens when variants emerge to which the vaccine S-atb are not sufficient/robust enough? It's very important to check high morbidity to rule out things like immunopathology or ADE. First guess is comorbidity, but guessing is not good enough.

@miranda_renate @Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical Don't forget your first tweet. A slightly higher mortality rate in those who have been double Vax is insignificant compared to the MUCH lower risk of catching once vaccinated. 

Stats support the conclusion it's much safer to be vaccinated than not.

@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical Well your certainly not wrong bc they can. Chances are, some more of the elderly are vaccinated and more of the younger population are not.... That might hypothesis is correct. But we would need the demographics first
@yolyabreuh @miranda_renate 🙏
@drbeen_medical @miranda_renate Thank you!
@yolyabreuh @miranda_renate Ok. Will do.

@drbeen_medical @miranda_renate Hi @drbeen_medical, I really really like if you will make us the honor to analize in your videos this very important article which it's related with Spike's biodistribution in the mRNA vaccines  https://t.co/hYTMy8pD6X
Thank You!
@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical Possibly because the old folks got the vaccine first and they already have the igg levels low?

@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical The UK delayed their second doses to get more first doses to the entire population first.  What this means is that a large number of those who have had their 2nd dose were either in a higher and more vulnerable age group or were high risk due to co-morbidities…
@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical @Muddle85071766 If you go to the uk government site they havenexcel files by sex age etc death and cases.  I downloaded them.
@dallas4life44 About 50% of the UK population is fully vaccinated.

@dallas4life44 @drbeen_medical 'I'd like to see the demographic breakdown' So do I. But why only the vaccinated? Comorbidities can also occur in the non-vaccinated group which makes them more susceptible to serious complications when infected, right?
@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical I'd like to see the demographic breakdown of the vaccinated people... Older with comorbidities who are susceptible?

@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical Is this age normalized? If yes, then maybe: if your system was not good enough to react to the vaccine and give you some imunity, it will also not work well vs the virus too.

@drbeen_medical @Kamran___Jamil Also what is happening in Taiwan? Huge spike in infection and deaths. This could not be something like immune escape, with only 6% vaccination rate? Spike paralell about 2 weeks after vaccination ramped up.

@drbeen_medical The 1x vaccinated group also had a slightly higher mortality rate. Non-vacc much higher infection, but lower mortality and less hospitalized. So it prefents infection but when they do get infected they appear more vulnerable?

@Muddle85071766 @drbeen_medical 1x vax also a slightly higher mortality. Age groups: I am not sure. Any age group in the UK can get vaccinated at this moment? Almost 50% of the population is fully vaccinated. Not only the vulnerable. Why haven't they checked/metioned the agegroups? Now it's a guess.

@Kamran___Jamil @drbeen_medical @miranda_renate Maybe he can also give a better explanation on the distribution studies and the consequences of migrating spike protein. His last one was very disappointing.
@Kamran___Jamil @miranda_renate Yes. Working on it.

@miranda_renate @drbeen_medical Observations, unvax mostly younger and unlikely to have serious illness, double vax mostly older and frailer so increased mortality risk whatever vax status. Also that data set starts in February and therefore is not up to date, let's see the data for the last 4 weeks.
@drbeen_medical @miranda_renate Hi, Dr Been ! Will you discuss this in today’s talk ?
@miranda_renate It maybe the cohort that was given the preference. Maybe immunepathology. Need to look at the data.

#delta Non-vacc: 19,573 cases 2% hospitalized 23 deaths. Fully #vaccinated:  1,785 cases 3% hospitalized, 12 deaths. Why such a high mortality rate in vaccinated group? @drbeen_medical https://t.co/YAFJLP3aDN
